availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
To the Sheriff of Jefferson County, Greeting:

You are hereby commanded to summon Wm Swincher together with B. S. Griffin and his bail, to appear before the Judge of the Jefferson Circuit Court, at the Court-House in the City of Louisville, on the first day of September Term of said Court, to show cause, if any they have or can, why the Commonwealth shall not have judgment and execution thereon against them, the said Wm Swincher in Three hundred dollars, and his bail in a like sum, according to the form and effect of a recognizance entered into by them in the City Court of Louisville on the 27 day of April 1865, and for a breach of the conditions thereof.

p.hi: Witness, JAMES P. CHAMBERS, Clerk of said Court, at the Court-House aforesaid, this

body.p:
J P Chambers
A Copy
